pageTitle: Itinerary for Monday, February 4, 2019 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

Ottawa, Ontario

9:15 a.m. The Prime Minister and Minister of Foreign Affairs Chrystia Freeland will deliver brief remarks at the opening session of the 10th ministerial meeting of the Lima Group.

John G. Diefenbaker Building
111 Sussex Drive

Notes for media:

    • Open coverage for remarks
    • Media are asked to arrive no later than 8:30 a.m. and follow the direction of the media signs.
    • Media will be required to present their accreditation badges.

9:45 a.m. The Prime Minister will meet with Premier of Nunavut Joe Savikataaq.

John G. Diefenbaker Building
111 Sussex Drive

Notes for media:

    • Pooled photo opportunity at the beginning of the meeting
    • Media are asked to arrive no later than 8:30 a.m. and follow the direction of the media signs.
    • Media will be required to present their accreditation badges.

2:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend Question Period.

8:00 p.m. The Prime Minister and Minister of Canadian Heritage and Multiculturalism Pablo Rodriguez will attend the Black History Month reception, and will deliver remarks. Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Ahmed Hussen will be in attendance.

National Arts Centre
1 Elgin Street

Notes for media:

    • Open coverage of remarks
    • Media are asked to arrive by the main entrance no later than 7:15 p.m.
